title: Schindler's List
simple_desc: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

title: Goodfellas
simple_desc: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

title: The Pianist
simple_desc: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

title: The Intouchables
simple_desc: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

title: Hamilton
simple_desc: The real life of one of America's foremost founding fathers and first Secretary of the Treasury, Alexander Hamilton. Captured live on Broadway from the Richard Rodgers Theater with the original Broadway cast.
stars: ['Lin-Manuel Miranda', 'Phillipa Soo', 'Leslie Odom Jr.', 'Renée Elise Goldsberry']

title: Amadeus
simple_desc: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporaneous composer who was deeply jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

title: Sardar Udham
simple_desc: A biopic detailing the 2 decades that Punjabi Sikh revolutionary Udham Singh spent planning the assassination of the man responsible for the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

title: Braveheart
simple_desc: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.

title: Lawrence of Arabia
simple_desc: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

title: Dangal
simple_desc: Former wrestler Mahavir Singh Phogat and his two wrestler daughters struggle towards glory at the Commonwealth Games in the face of societal oppression.

title: Shershaah
simple_desc: Shershaah is the story of PVC awardee Indian soldier Capt. Vikram Batra, whose bravery and unflinching courage in chasing the Pakistani soldiers out of Indian territory contributed immensely in India finally winning the Kargil War in 1999.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
simple_desc: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

title: Green Book
simple_desc: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver for an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.

title: A Beautiful Mind
simple_desc: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

title: Downfall
simple_desc: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

title: The Elephant Man
simple_desc: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous façade, there is revealed a person of kindness, intelligence and sophistication.

title: Dersu Uzala
simple_desc: The Russian army sends an explorer on an expedition to the snowy Siberian wilderness where he makes friends with a seasoned local hunter.

title: The Passion of Joan of Arc
simple_desc: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

title: Close-Up
simple_desc: The true story of Hossain Sabzian, a cinephile who impersonated the director Mohsen Makhmalbaf to convince a family they would star in his so-called new film.

title: Bhaag Milkha Bhaag
simple_desc: The truth behind the ascension of Milkha Singh, who was scarred by of the India-Pakistan partition.

title: Paan Singh Tomar
simple_desc: The story of Paan Singh Tomar, an Indian athlete and seven-time national steeplechase champion who becomes one of the most feared dacoits in Chambal Valley after his retirement.

title: Hacksaw Ridge
simple_desc: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

title: Ford v Ferrari
simple_desc: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference and the laws of physics to build a revolutionary race car for Ford in order to defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

title: Catch Me If You Can
simple_desc: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

title: Into the Wild
simple_desc: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

title: Spotlight
simple_desc: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

title: The Sound of Music
simple_desc: A young novice is sent by her convent in 1930s Austria to become a governess to the seven children of a widowed naval officer.

title: Rush
simple_desc: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.

title: 12 Years a Slave
simple_desc: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

title: Raging Bull
simple_desc: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
simple_desc: A college professor bonds with an abandoned dog he takes into his home.

title: Hotel Rwanda
simple_desc: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.

title: In the Name of the Father
simple_desc: A man's coerced confession to an I.R.A. bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.

title: Inherit the Wind
simple_desc: Based on a real-life case in 1925, two great lawyers argue the case for and against a Tennessee science teacher accused of the crime of teaching evolution.

title: Andrei Rublev
simple_desc: The life, times and afflictions of the fifteenth-century Russian iconographer St. Andrei Rublev.

title: The Message
simple_desc: This epic historical drama chronicles the life and times of Prophet Muhammad and serves as an introduction to early Islamic history.

title: The Imitation Game
simple_desc: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.

title: The Pursuit of Happyness
simple_desc: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career.

title: Dog Day Afternoon
simple_desc: Three amateur bank robbers plan to hold up a bank. A nice simple robbery: Walk in, take the money, and run. Unfortunately, the supposedly uncomplicated heist suddenly becomes a bizarre nightmare as everything that could go wrong does.

title: Ip Man
simple_desc: During the Japanese invasion of China, a wealthy martial artist is forced to leave his home when his city is occupied. With little means of providing for themselves, Ip Man and the remaining members of the city must find a way to survive.

title: The King's Speech
simple_desc: The story of King George VI, his unexpected ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
simple_desc: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.

title: Lion
simple_desc: A five-year-old Indian boy is adopted by an Australian couple after getting lost hundreds of kilometers from home. 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.

title: Papillon
simple_desc: A French convict in the 1930s befriends a fellow criminal as the two of them begin serving their sentence in the South American penal colony on Devil's Island, which inspires the man to plot his escape.

title: Cinderella Man
simple_desc: The story of James J. Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to challenge for the heavyweight championship of the world.

title: Gandhi
simple_desc: The life of the lawyer who became the famed leader of the Indian revolts against the British rule through his philosophy of nonviolent protest.

title: Mirror
simple_desc: A dying man in his forties remembers his past. His childhood, his mother, the war, personal moments and things that tell of the recent history of all the Russian nation.

title: The Straight Story
simple_desc: An old man makes a long journey by lawnmower to mend his relationship with an ill brother.
stars: ['Richard Farnsworth', 'Sissy Spacek', 'Jane Galloway Heitz', 'Joseph A. Carpenter']

title: The Sea Inside
simple_desc: The factual story of Spaniard Ramon Sampedro, who fought a 28-year campaign in favor of euthanasia and his own right to die.

title: Persepolis
simple_desc: A precocious and outspoken Iranian girl grows up during the Islamic Revolution.

title: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
simple_desc: The true story of Elle editor Jean-Dominique Bauby who suffers a stroke and has to live with an almost totally paralyzed body; only his left eye isn't paralyzed.

title: M.S. Dhoni: The Untold Story
simple_desc: The untold story of Mahendra Singh Dhoni's journey from ticket collector to trophy collector - the world-cup-winning captain of the Indian Cricket Team.

title: Bohemian Rhapsody
simple_desc: The story of the legendary British rock band Queen and lead singer Freddie Mercury, leading up to their famous performance at Live Aid (1985).

title: Dallas Buyers Club
simple_desc: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

title: Spartacus
simple_desc: The slave Spartacus survives brutal training as a gladiator and leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic, as the ambitious Crassus seeks to gain power by crushing the uprising.

title: Patton
simple_desc: The World War II phase of the career of controversial American general George S. Patton.

title: Togo
simple_desc: The story of Togo, the sled dog who led the 1925 serum run despite being considered too small and weak to lead such an intense race.

title: The Lion in Winter
simple_desc: 1183 A.D.: King Henry II's three sons all want to inherit the throne, but he won't commit to a choice. When he allows his imprisoned wife Eleanor of Aquitaine out for a Christmas visit, they all variously plot to force him into a decision.

title: In Cold Blood
simple_desc: Two ex-cons murder a family in a robbery attempt, before going on the run from the authorities. The police try to piece together the details of the murder in an attempt to track down the killers.

title: Super 30
simple_desc: Based on the life of Patna-based mathematician Anand Kumar who runs the famed Super 30 program for IIT aspirants in Patna.

title: Tombstone
simple_desc: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

title: The Irishman
simple_desc: An illustration of Frank Sheeran's life, from W.W.II veteran to hit-man for the Bufalino crime family and his alleged assassination of his close friend Jimmy Hoffa.

title: Hidden Figures
simple_desc: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.

title: The Big Short
simple_desc: In 2006-2007 a group of investors bet against the United States mortgage market. In their research, they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.

title: The Social Network
simple_desc: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.

title: American Gangster
simple_desc: An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film.

title: Remember the Titans
simple_desc: The true story of a newly appointed African-American coach and his high school team on their first season as a racially integrated unit.

title: Captain Phillips
simple_desc: The true story of Captain Richard Phillips and the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the U.S.-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years.

title: The Right Stuff
simple_desc: The U.S. space program's development from the breaking of the sound barrier to selection of the Mercury 7 astronauts, from a group of test pilots with a more seat-of-the-pants approach than the program's more cautious engineers preferred.

title: The Fighter
simple_desc: Based on the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.

title: Awakenings
simple_desc: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.

title: Thirteen Lives
simple_desc: A rescue mission is assembled in Thailand where a group of young boys and their soccer coach are trapped in a system of underground caves that are flooding.

title: Glory
simple_desc: Robert Gould Shaw leads the U.S. Civil War's first all-black volunteer company, fighting prejudices from both his own Union Army, and the Confederates.

title: Walk the Line
simple_desc: A chronicle of country music legend Johnny Cash's life, from his early days on an Arkansas cotton farm to his rise to fame with Sun Records in Memphis, where he recorded alongside Elvis Presley, Jerry Lee Lewis, and Carl Perkins.

title: Straight Outta Compton
simple_desc: The rap group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.
stars: ["O'Shea Jackson Jr.", 'Corey Hawkins', 'Jason Mitchell', 'Neil Brown Jr.']

title: The Insider
simple_desc: A research chemist comes under personal and professional attack when he decides to appear in a 60 Minutes exposé on Big Tobacco.

title: Pride
simple_desc: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

title: October Sky
simple_desc: The true story of Homer Hickam, a coal miner's son who was inspired by the first Sputnik launch to take up rocketry against his father's wishes.

title: Ed Wood
simple_desc: Ambitious but troubled movie director Edward D. Wood Jr. tries his best to fulfill his dreams despite his lack of talent.

title: Changeling
simple_desc: Grief-stricken mother Christine Collins takes on the L.A.P.D. to her own detriment when they try to pass off an obvious impostor as her missing child.

title: My Left Foot
simple_desc: Christy Brown, born with cerebral palsy, learns to paint and write with his only controllable limb - his left foot.

title: The Killing Fields
simple_desc: A journalist is trapped in Cambodia during tyrant Pol Pot's bloody 'Year Zero' cleansing campaign, which claimed the lives of two million 'undesirable' civilians.

title: The World's Fastest Indian
simple_desc: The story of New Zealander Burt Munro, who spent years rebuilding a 1920 Indian motorcycle, which helped him set the land speed world record at Utah's Bonneville Salt Flats in 1967.

title: Aguirre, the Wrath of God
simple_desc: In the 16th century, the ruthless and insane Don Lope de Aguirre leads a Spanish expedition in search of El Dorado.

title: Gangubai Kathiawadi
simple_desc: Duped and sold to a brothel, a young woman fearlessly reclaims her power, using underworld connections to preside over the world she was once a pawn in.

title: The Postman
simple_desc: A simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to a famous poet, and then uses this to woo local beauty Beatrice.

title: Embrace of the Serpent
simple_desc: The story of the relationship between Karamakate, an Amazonian shaman and last survivor of his people, and two scientists who work together over the course of forty years to search the Amazon for a sacred healing plant.

title: Argo
simple_desc: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.

title: Serpico
simple_desc: An honest New York cop named Frank Serpico blows the whistle on rampant corruption in the force only to have his comrades turn against him.

title: Donnie Brasco
simple_desc: An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.

title: The Theory of Everything
simple_desc: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.

title: Bonnie and Clyde
simple_desc: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

title: Ray
simple_desc: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s.

title: Malcolm X
simple_desc: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam and his eventual assassination.

title: The Last Emperor
simple_desc: Bernardo Bertolucci's Oscar-winning dramatisation of the life story of China's last emperor, Pu Yi.

title: The Wind Rises
simple_desc: A look at the life of Jiro Horikoshi, the man who designed Japanese fighter planes during World War II.

title: Finding Neverland
simple_desc: The story of Sir J.M. Barrie's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.

title: Never Look Away
simple_desc: German artist Kurt Barnert has escaped East Germany and now lives in West Germany, but is tormented by his childhood under the Nazis and the GDR-regime.

title: A Man for All Seasons
simple_desc: The story of Sir Thomas More, who stood up to King Henry VIII when the King rejected the Roman Catholic Church to obtain a divorce and remarry.

title: The Motorcycle Diaries
simple_desc: The dramatization of a motorcycle road trip Che Guevara went on in his youth that showed him his life's calling.
stars: ['Gael García Bernal', 'Rodrigo de la Serna', 'Mía Maestro', 'Mercedes Morán']

title: Frost/Nixon
simple_desc: A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.

title: Missing
simple_desc: When an idealistic American writer disappears during the Chilean coup d'état in September 1973, his wife and father try to find him.

title: Moneyball
simple_desc: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.

title: The Blind Side
simple_desc: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All-American football player and first-round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

title: Dark Waters
simple_desc: A corporate defense attorney takes on an environmental lawsuit against a chemical company that exposes a lengthy history of pollution.

title: Just Mercy
simple_desc: World-renowned civil rights defense attorney Bryan Stevenson works to free a wrongly condemned death row prisoner.
stars: ['Michael B. Jordan', 'Jamie Foxx', 'Brie Larson', 'Charlie Pye Jr.']

title: Only the Brave
simple_desc: Based on the true story of the Granite Mountain Hotshots, a group of elite firefighters who risk everything to protect a town from a historic wildfire.

title: Escape from Alcatraz
simple_desc: Alcatraz is the most secure prison of its time. It is believed that no one can ever escape from it, until three daring men make a possibly successful attempt at escaping from one of the most infamous prisons in the world.

title: Argentina, 1985
simple_desc: A team of lawyers takes on the heads of Argentina's bloody military dictatorship during the 1980s in a battle against odds and a race against time.

title: Freedom Writers
simple_desc: A young teacher inspires her class of at-risk students to learn tolerance, apply themselves and pursue education beyond high school.

title: The Last King of Scotland
simple_desc: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s.

title: The Hurricane
simple_desc: The story of Rubin 'Hurricane' Carter, a boxer wrongly imprisoned for murder, and the people who aided in his fight to prove his innocence.

title: The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind
simple_desc: Against all the odds, a thirteen-year-old boy in Malawi invents an unconventional way to save his family and village from famine.

title: The Two Popes
simple_desc: Behind Vatican walls, the conservative Pope Benedict XVI and the liberal future Pope Francis must find common ground to forge a new path for the Catholic Church.

title: Philomena
simple_desc: A world-weary political journalist picks up the story of a woman's search for her son, who was taken away from her decades ago after she became pregnant and was forced to live in a convent.

title: La Vie En Rose
simple_desc: Biopic of the iconic French singer Édith Piaf. Raised by her grandmother in a brothel, she was discovered while singing on a street corner at the age of 19. Despite her success, Piaf's life was filled with tragedy.

title: Control
simple_desc: A profile of Ian Curtis, the enigmatic singer of Joy Division whose personal, professional, and romantic troubles led him to commit suicide at the age of 23.

title: Fearless
simple_desc: A biography of Chinese Martial Arts Master Huo Yuanjia, who is the founder and spiritual guru of the Jin Wu Sports Federation.

title: Shine
simple_desc: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular if not critical acclaim.

title: Sanju
simple_desc: Biopic of the controversial life of actor Sanjay Dutt: his film career, jail sentence, and personal life.

title: Mutiny on the Bounty
simple_desc: First mate Fletcher Christian leads a revolt against his sadistic commander, Captain Bligh, in this classic seafaring adventure, based on the real-life 1789 mutiny.

title: Sophie Scholl: The Final Days
simple_desc: A dramatization of the final days of Sophie Scholl, one of the most famous members of the German World War II anti-Nazi resistance movement, The White Rose.

title: Neerja
simple_desc: The story of courageous Neerja Bhanot, who sacrificed her life while protecting the lives of 359 passengers on Pan Am Flight 73 in 1986 when it was hijacked by a terrorist organization.

title: The Greatest Showman
simple_desc: Celebrates the birth of show business and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.

title: Lone Survivor
simple_desc: Marcus Luttrell and his team set out on a mission to capture or kill notorious Taliban leader Ahmad Shah, in late June 2005. Marcus and his team are left to fight for their lives in one of the most valiant efforts of modern warfare.

title: The Favourite
simple_desc: In early 18th-century England, the status quo at the court is upset when a new servant arrives and endears herself to a frail Queen Anne.

title: The Aviator
simple_desc: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.

title: I, Tonya
simple_desc: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U.S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the activity is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.

title: Blow
simple_desc: The story of how George Jung, along with the Medellín Cartel headed by Pablo Escobar, established the American cocaine market in the 1970s in the United States.

title: BlacKkKlansman
simple_desc: Ron Stallworth, an African American police officer from Colorado Springs, Colorado, successfully infiltrates the local Ku Klux Klan branch aided by a Jewish surrogate who eventually becomes its leader. Based on actual events.

title: Richard Jewell
simple_desc: Security guard Richard Jewell is an instant hero after foiling a bomb attack at the 1996 Atlanta Olympics, but his life becomes a nightmare when the FBI leaks to the media that he is a suspect in the case.

title: tick, tick... BOOM!
simple_desc: On the cusp of his 30th birthday, a promising young theater composer navigates love, friendship and the pressures of life as an artist in New York City.

title: Rudy
simple_desc: Rudy has always been told that he was too small to play college football. But he is determined to overcome the odds and fulfill his dream of playing for Notre Dame.

title: 127 Hours
simple_desc: A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

title: King Richard
simple_desc: A look at how tennis superstars Venus and Serena Williams became who they are after the coaching from their father Richard Williams.

title: Midnight Express
simple_desc: Billy Hayes, an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.

title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
simple_desc: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.

title: Boys Don't Cry
simple_desc: A young man named Brandon Teena navigates love, life, and being transgender in rural Nebraska.

title: Saving Mr. Banks
simple_desc: Author P.L. Travers reflects on her childhood after reluctantly meeting with Walt Disney, who seeks to adapt her Mary Poppins books for the big screen.
In 1947, Jackie Robinson becomes the first African-American to play in Major League Baseball in the modern era when he was signed by the Brooklyn Dodgers and faces considerable racism in the process.

title: Milk
simple_desc: The story of Harvey Milk, and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.

title: Chaplin
simple_desc: An elderly Charlie Chaplin discusses his autobiography with his editor, recounting his amazing journey from his poverty-stricken childhood to world-wide success after the ingenious invention of the Little Tramp.

title: Christiane F.
simple_desc: A teen girl in 1970s Berlin becomes addicted to heroin. Everything in her life slowly begins to distort and disappear as she befriends a small crew of junkies and falls in love with a drug-abusing male prostitute.

title: Selma
simple_desc: A chronicle of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, in 1965.

title: The Great Debaters
simple_desc: A drama based on the true story of Melvin B. Tolson, a professor at Wiley College Texas. In 1935, he inspired students to form the school's first debate team, which went on to challenge Harvard in the national championship.

title: Hunger
simple_desc: Irish republican Bobby Sands leads the inmates of a Northern Irish prison in a hunger strike.

title: Ip Man 2
simple_desc: Centering on Ip Man's migration to Hong Kong in 1949 as he attempts to propagate his discipline of Wing Chun martial arts.

title: A Royal Affair
simple_desc: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.

title: Fruitvale Station
simple_desc: The story of Oscar Grant III, a 22-year-old Bay Area resident, who crosses paths with friends, enemies, family, and strangers on the last day of 2008.

title: Quiz Show
simple_desc: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.

title: Henry V
simple_desc: In the midst of the Hundred Years War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

title: The Damned United
simple_desc: The story of the controversial Brian Clough's 44-day reign as the coach of the English football club Leeds United.

title: Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior
simple_desc: Tanhaji Malusare, a military chieftain in the army of the Maratha king Shivaji, leads the charge to capture the strategically important Kondhana fort guarded by the army of the fierce Rajput chieftain Udaybhan Rathod.

title: Mesrine: Killer Instinct
simple_desc: The story of the notorious French gangster Jacques Mesrine, with the focus on his life before the early 1970s and the events that led to him being declared Public Enemy No. 1 in France.

title: Tetris
simple_desc: The story of how one of the world's most popular video games found its way to players around the globe. Businessman Henk Rogers and Tetris inventor Alexey Pajitnov join forces in the USSR, risking it all to bring Tetris to the masses.

title: Darkest Hour
simple_desc: In May 1940, the fate of World War II hangs on Winston Churchill, who must decide whether to negotiate with Adolf Hitler, or fight on knowing that it could mean the end of the British Empire.

title: Erin Brockovich
simple_desc: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

title: The Mauritanian
simple_desc: Mohamedou Ould Slahi fights for freedom after being detained and imprisoned without charge by the U.S. Government for years.
stars: ['Tahar Rahim', 'Nouhe Hamady Bari', 'Saadna Hamoud', 'Mohamed Yeslem Mousse']

title: Sully
simple_desc: When pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger lands his damaged plane on the Hudson River in order to save the flight's passengers and crew, some consider him a hero while others think he was reckless.

title: Molly's Game
simple_desc: The true story of Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game and became an FBI target.

title: The Swimmers
simple_desc: From war-torn Syria to the 2016 Rio Olympics, two young sisters embark on a harrowing journey as refugees, putting both their hearts and champion swimming skills to heroic use.

title: A Hidden Life
simple_desc: The Austrian Franz Jägerstätter, a conscientious objector, refuses to fight for the Nazis in World War II.

title: Judas and the Black Messiah
simple_desc: Offered a plea deal by the FBI, William O'Neal infiltrates the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party to gather intelligence on Chairman Fred Hampton.

title: Miracle
simple_desc: The true story of Herb Brooks, the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Soviet squad.

title: Elizabeth
simple_desc: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

title: Good Night, and Good Luck.
simple_desc: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.

title: McFarland, USA
simple_desc: Jim White moves his family after losing his last job as a football coach, and at his new school he turns seven disappointing students into one of the best cross-country teams in the region.

title: Man on the Moon
simple_desc: The life and career of legendary comedian Andy Kaufman.

title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
simple_desc: In the 1913 U.S. Open, twenty-year-old Francis Ouimet played golf against his idol, 1900 U.S. Open champion, Englishman Harry Vardon.

title: Searching for Bobby Fischer
simple_desc: A prepubescent chess prodigy is encouraged to harden himself in order to become a champion like the famous but unlikable Bobby Fischer.

title: Love & Mercy
simple_desc: In the 60s, Beach Boys leader Brian Wilson struggles with emerging psychosis as he attempts to craft his avant-garde pop masterpiece. In the 80s, he's a broken, confused man under the 24-hour watch of shady therapist, Dr. Eugene Landy.

title: Rabbit-Proof Fence
simple_desc: In 1931, three half-white, half-Aboriginal girls escape after being plucked from their houses to be trained as domestic staff, and set off on a journey across the Outback.

title: Trumbo
simple_desc: In 1947, Dalton Trumbo was Hollywood's top screenwriter, until he and other artists were jailed and blacklisted for their political beliefs.

title: The King and I
simple_desc: A widow accepts a job as a live-in governess to the King of Siam's children.

title: Immortal Beloved
simple_desc: The life and death of the legendary Ludwig van Beethoven. Besides all the work he is known for, the composer once wrote a famous love letter to a nameless beloved, and the movie tries to ...                See full summary »

title: American Splendor
simple_desc: An original mix of fiction and reality illuminates the life of comic book hero everyman Harvey Pekar.

title: Amazing Grace
simple_desc: The idealist William Wilberforce (Ioan Gruffudd) maneuvers his way through Parliament, endeavoring to end the British transatlantic slave trade.

title: The Good Lie
simple_desc: A group of Sudanese refugees, given the chance to resettle in the U.S., arrive in Kansas City, Missouri, where their encounter with an employment agency counselor forever changes all of their lives.

title: Mesrine: Public Enemy No. 1
simple_desc: The story of the notorious French gangster Jacques Mesrine, with the focus on his life and death as France's Public Enemy No. 1 in the 1970s.

title: What's Love Got to Do with It
simple_desc: The story of singer Tina Turner's rise to stardom and how she gained the courage to break free from her abusive husband, Ike Turner.

title: Elvis
simple_desc: The life of American music icon Elvis Presley, from his childhood to becoming a rock and movie star in the 1950s while maintaining a complex relationship with his manager, Colonel Tom Parker.

title: Coach Carter
simple_desc: Controversy surrounds high school basketball coach Ken Carter after he benches his entire team for breaking their academic contract with him.

title: American Sniper
simple_desc: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home with his family after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

title: The King
simple_desc: Hal, wayward prince and heir to the English throne, is crowned King Henry V after his tyrannical father dies. Now the young king must navigate palace politics, the war his father left behind, and the emotional strings of his past life.

title: Beautiful Boy
simple_desc: Based on the best-selling pair of memoirs from father and son David and Nic Sheff, Beautiful Boy chronicles the heartbreaking and inspiring experience of survival, relapse and recovery in a family coping with addiction over many years.

title: Girl, Interrupted
simple_desc: Based on writer Susanna Kaysen's account of her 18-month stay at a mental hospital in the late 1960s.

title: Rocketman
simple_desc: A musical fantasy about the fantastical human story of Elton John's breakthrough years.

title: Monster
simple_desc: Based on the life of Aileen Wuornos, a Daytona Beach prostitute who became a serial killer.

title: Lincoln
simple_desc: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

title: First Man
simple_desc: A look at the life of the astronaut, Neil Armstrong, and the legendary space mission that led him to become the first man to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969.

title: The Basketball Diaries
simple_desc: A teenager finds his dreams of becoming a basketball star threatened after he free falls into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

title: Heavenly Creatures
simple_desc: Two teenage girls share a unique bond; their parents, concerned that the friendship is too intense, separate them, and the girls take revenge.

title: Belfast
simple_desc: A young boy and his working-class Belfast family experience the tumultuous late 1960s.

title: Good Morning, Vietnam
simple_desc: In 1965, an unorthodox and irreverent DJ named Adrian Cronauer begins to shake up things when he is assigned to the U.S. Armed Services radio station in Vietnam.

title: The Disaster Artist
simple_desc: When aspiring actor Greg Sestero meets the weird and mysterious Tommy Wiseau in an acting class, they form a unique friendship and travel to Hollywood to make their dreams come true.

title: Snowden
simple_desc: The NSA's illegal surveillance techniques are leaked to the public by one of the agency's employees, Edward Snowden, in the form of thousands of classified documents distributed to the press.

title: Official Secrets
simple_desc: The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq.

title: Amistad
simple_desc: In 1839, the revolt of Mende captives aboard a Spanish owned ship causes a major controversy in the United States when the ship is captured off the coast of Long Island. The courts must decide whether the Mende are slaves or legally free.

title: This Boy's Life
simple_desc: The story about the relationship between a rebellious 1950s teenager and his abusive stepfather, based on the memoirs of writer and literature Professor Tobias Wolff.

title: Frida
simple_desc: A biography of artist Frida Kahlo, who channeled the pain of a crippling injury and her tempestuous marriage into her work.

title: The Banker
simple_desc: In the 1960s, two African-American entrepreneurs hire a working-class white man to pretend to be the head of their business empire while they pose as a janitor and chauffeur.

title: Invictus
simple_desc: Nelson Mandela, in his first term as President of South Africa, initiates a unique venture to unite the Apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.

title: Stand and Deliver
simple_desc: The story of Jaime Escalante, a high school teacher who successfully inspired his dropout-prone students to learn calculus.

title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
simple_desc: The story of controversial pornography publisher Larry Flynt, and how he became a defender of free speech.

title: Capote
simple_desc: In 1959, Truman Capote learns of the murder of a Kansas family and decides to write a book about the case. While researching for his novel In Cold Blood, Capote forms a relationship with one of the killers, Perry Smith, who is on death row.
stars: ['Philip Seymour Hoffman', 'Clifton Collins Jr.', 'Catherine Keener', 'Allie Mickelson']

title: Rescue Dawn
simple_desc: A U.S. fighter pilot's epic struggle of survival after being shot down on a mission over Laos during the Vietnam War.

title: The Walk
simple_desc: In 1974, high-wire artist Philippe Petit recruits a team of people to help him realize his dream: to walk the immense void between the World Trade Center towers.

title: Belle
simple_desc: The biracial daughter, Dido Elizabeth Belle (Gugu Mbatha-Raw), of Royal Navy Captain Sir John Lindsay (Matthew Goode) is raised by aristocratic Great-uncle Lord William Murray, 1st Earl of Mansfield (Tom Wilkinson) in 18th century England.

title: Woman in Gold
simple_desc: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.

title: Eddie the Eagle
simple_desc: The story of Eddie Edwards, the notoriously tenacious British underdog ski jumper who charmed the world at the 1988 Winter Olympics.

title: Reds
simple_desc: A radical American journalist becomes involved with the Communist revolution in Russia, and hopes to bring its spirit and idealism to the United States.

title: Funny Girl
simple_desc: The life of Fanny Brice, famed comedienne and entertainer of the early 1900s. We see her rise to fame as a Ziegfeld girl, subsequent career, and her personal life, particularly her relationship with Nick Arnstein.

title: Antwone Fisher
simple_desc: Antwone Fisher, a young navy man, is forced to see a psychiatrist after a violent outburst against a fellow crewman. During the course of treatment a painful past is revealed and a new hope begins.

title: The Queen
simple_desc: After the death of Princess Diana, Queen Elizabeth II struggles with her reaction to a sequence of events nobody could have predicted.

title: Gods and Monsters
simple_desc: The last days of Frankenstein (1931) director James Whale are explored.

title: Marshall
simple_desc: The story of Thurgood Marshall, the crusading lawyer who would become the first African-American Supreme Court Justice, as he battles through one of his career-defining cases.

title: 24 Hour Party People
simple_desc: In 1976, Tony Wilson sets up Factory Records and brings Manchester's music to the world.

title: Angela's Ashes
simple_desc: Based on the best-selling autobiography by Irish expatriate Frank McCourt, Angela's Ashes follows the experiences of young Frankie and his family as they try against all odds to escape the ...                See full summary »

title: A Street Cat Named Bob
simple_desc: The true feel-good story of how James Bowen, a busker and recovering drug addict, has his life transformed when he meets a stray ginger cat. Based on the international best selling book.

title: Lorenzo's Oil
simple_desc: Lorenzo Odone, a Virginia 5-year-old, develops a degenerative nerve disease so rare that nobody is working on a cure, so his parents decide to immerse themselves in research and tackle the problem themselves.

title: The Baader Meinhof Complex
simple_desc: A look at Germany's terrorist group, The Red Army Faction (RAF), which organized bombings, robberies, kidnappings, and assassinations in the late 1960s and '70s.

title: Max Manus: Man of War
simple_desc: The true story about one of the most brilliant saboteurs during World War II and his battle to overcome his inner demons.

title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
simple_desc: Based on the true story of a real-life friendship between Fred Rogers and journalist Lloyd Vogel.

title: The Young Victoria
simple_desc: A dramatization of the turbulent first years of Queen Victoria's rule, and her enduring romance with Prince Albert.

title: The Founder
simple_desc: The story of Ray Kroc, a salesman who turned two brothers' innovative fast food eatery, McDonald's, into the biggest restaurant business in the world, with a combination of ambition, persistence, and ruthlessness.

title: Unbroken
simple_desc: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.

title: Vice
simple_desc: The story of Dick Cheney, an unassuming bureaucratic Washington insider, who quietly wielded immense power as Vice President to George W. Bush, reshaping the country and the globe in ways that are still felt today.

title: Born on the Fourth of July
simple_desc: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country for which he fought.

title: Lawless
simple_desc: Set in Depression-era Franklin County, Virginia, a trio of bootlegging brothers are threatened by a new special deputy and other authorities angling for a cut of their profits.

title: Men of Honor
simple_desc: The story of Carl Brashear, the first African-American U.S. Navy Diver, and the man who trained him.
stars: ['Cuba Gooding Jr.', 'Robert De Niro', 'Charlize Theron', 'Aunjanue Ellis-Taylor']

title: Papillon
simple_desc: Wrongfully convicted for murder, Henri Charriere forms an unlikely relationship with fellow inmate and quirky convicted counterfeiter, Louis Dega, in an attempt to escape from the notorious penal colony on Devil's Island.

title: The Post
simple_desc: A cover-up spanning four U.S. Presidents pushes the country's first female newspaper publisher and her editor to join an unprecedented battle between press and government.

title: Mask
simple_desc: A teenager with a massive facial skull deformity and biker gang mother attempt to live as normal a life as possible under the circumstances.

title: Steve Jobs
simple_desc: Steve Jobs takes us behind the scenes of the digital revolution, to paint a portrait of the man at its epicenter. The story unfolds backstage at three iconic product launches, ending in 1998 with the unveiling of the iMac.

title: Anthropoid
simple_desc: Based on the extraordinary true story of Operation Anthropoid, the WWII mission to assassinate SS General Reinhard Heydrich, the main architect behind the Final Solution and the Reich's third in command after Hitler and Himmler.

title: The Doors
simple_desc: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band The Doors and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.

title: The Report
simple_desc: Idealistic Senate staffer Daniel J. Jones, tasked by his boss to lead an investigation into the CIA's post 9/11 Detention and Interrogation Program, uncovers shocking secrets.

title: The Butler
simple_desc: As Cecil Gaines serves eight presidents during his tenure as a butler at the White House, the civil rights movement, Vietnam, and other major events affect this man's life, family, and American society.

title: An American Crime
simple_desc: The true story of suburban housewife Gertrude Baniszewski, who kept a teenage girl locked in the basement of her Indiana home during the 1960s.

title: Quills
simple_desc: In a Napoleonic era insane asylum, an inmate, the irrepressible Marquis De Sade, fights a battle of wills against a tyrannically prudish doctor.

title: The Professor and the Madman
simple_desc: Professor James Murray begins work compiling words for the first edition of the Oxford English Dictionary in the mid-19th century, and receives over 10,000 entries from a patient at Broadmoor Criminal Lunatic Asylum, Dr. William Minor.

title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
simple_desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneer Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor, Professor G.H. Hardy.

title: Secretariat
simple_desc: Penny Chenery Tweedy and colleagues guide her long-shot but precocious stallion to set, in 1973, the unbeaten record for winning the Triple Crown.

title: Stan & Ollie
simple_desc: Laurel and Hardy, the world's most famous comedy duo, attempt to reignite their film careers as they embark on what becomes their swan song: a grueling theatre tour of post-war Britain.
